byline.original: By CAMPBELL ROBERTSON and MICHAEL D. SHEAR
byline.contributor: Campbell Robertson reported from Zachary, La., and Michael D. Shear from Washington. Alan Blinder contributed reporting from Atlanta.

lead_paragraph: Mr. Obama met with residents on a trip that required a delicate mix of compassion and politics.

headline.print_headline: Obama Visits Victims of Flooding, but Some Are Busy Just Hanging On
headline.main: Obama Visits Louisiana Flood Victims, but Some Are Busy Just Hanging On

snippet: Mr. Obama met with residents on a trip that required a delicate mix of compassion and politics....
abstract: Pres Obama's visit to Baton Rouge more than one week after floods ravage Louisiana earns praise from local leaders who who cite speedy response by federal government, but critics slam Obama for remaining on vacation during crisis; many residents say they did not know, or care, about president's visit because they have been too busy dealing with flood's aftermath.
